Monuments of Agra.#Newline"It was built in the 17th century by Shah Jahan in memory of his third wife Mumtaz Mahal".#NewlineIt attracts around 3-4 million tourists every year.ï¿½#Newline It appears pink in the morning#Comma white in the day and changes to golden in the moonlight.#Newline

The construction of the Taj Mahal started in 1631 and ended in 1653.#Newline The architecture is a combination of Persian#Comma Islamic and Indian styles.#Newline Ustad Ahmad Lahauri was the architect of Taj Mahal.#Newline 30 different varieties of semi precious and precious stones were used and is perfectly symmetrical in every way except for the two tombs.#Newline

column2: the slow decay of taj mahal
column5: Some of the major threats are air and water pollution which are not only affecting the tombs but also making the outer layer of the taj mahal discolor.

Around 1000 elephants were employed for the transportation of construction material.#Newline The construction cost of this masterpiece monument was around Rs.320 million.#NewlineMany types of marbles used were brought from China#Comma Afghanistan#Comma Sri lanka and Arabia.#Newline In recent times#Comma different studies suggest that the Taj Mahal is sinking in the Yamuna river.
